desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.Il existe des déclencheur spécifique (au: Specific triggers exist (different from the one provided by commands)
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.Attention à bien mettre des ' ou \" (quo: Warning ! Keep in mind to use ‘ or " (quote or double quote) when using string
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.Vous pouvez utiliser n'importe lequel de: You can use the following symbols as math operators :
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.Vous pouvez combiner n'importe quelle op: You can combine operation with the following symbols :
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.Vous pouvez aussi utiliser les tags suiv: You can use the following tags :
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.#time# : heure et minute courante (ex :: #time# : current hour and minute (e.g. : 1715 for 5.15 p.m.)
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.#date# : jour et mois courant (ex : 1215: #date# : current day and month (e.g. : 1215 for the 15th december)
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.rand(1,10) : pour un nombre aléatoire de: rand(1,10) : for a random number between 1 and 10
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.variable(mavariable,valeur par default): variable(myvariable,default value) : Recovery of variable value or wished default value    E.g.: variable(plop,10) gives variable value plop or 10 if it’s empty or doesn’t exist
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.En plus des commandes domotiques vous av: In addition to automation commands, you have access to the following functions:
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.Vous pouvez aussi utiliser les tags suiv: You can use the following tags in the options:
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.#sjour# : pour le nom du jour de la sema: #sjour# : for the week day name (in english) (E.g. : sunday)
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.rand[1-10] : pour un nombre aléatoire de: rand[1-10] : for random number between 1 and 10
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.Retourne l'objet commande correspondant\:
Send back corresponding « command » object
    $string => link to the wished command : [type].[device name].[command name] (e.g. : [weather].[Villeurbanne].[Temperature])

Send back corresponding « command » object
    $string => Id of the wished command (see General => Display)
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.filename => nom du fichier de log\r\n:
filename => name of log file
    level => [debug],[info],[error],[event]
    message => message to write in log
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.Retourne le nom du scénario courant: Send back the name of  the current scenario
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.Retourne le groupe du scénario: Send back the group of the scenario
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.Retourne l'état du scénario: Send back the state of the scenario
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.Permet d'activer ou non le scénario\r\n:
Allow to activate (or not) a scenario
    $active => 1 enabled , 0 disabled
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.Permet de dire si le scénario est en cou:
Allow to tell if the scenario is running or not
    $onGoing => 1 running , 0 stopped
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.Sauvegarde une donnée\r\n $key => cle:
Save a data
    $key => key of the value (int or string)
    $value => value to keep (int, string, array or object)
desktop\/modal\/help.scenario.php.Récupère une donnée\r\n $key => clef:
Get back a data
    $key => key of the value (int ou string)

desktop\/modal\/help.website.php.Aucune aide n'existe pour le moment sur: At this moment no help exist on this page

desktop\/modal\/help.interact.php.Le principe est le suivant : une phrase: The prinicple is the following: a command sentence triggers a unique command. To make easier the sentence creation you can use key words so that Jeedom automatically generate a list of sentences.
desktop\/modal\/help.interact.php.Vous pouvez utiliser #commande# et #obj: You can use #commande# and #objet# (both must be used together) to create a list of commands (you can filter the generation to reduce the list). You can also use #equipement# (useful if many commands belonging to the same object have the same name)
desktop\/modal\/help.interact.php.Lors de la génération des commandes vous: During the generation of commands you can use the synonym field (syn1=syn2,syn3|syn4=syn5) to replace names of objects, devices and/or commands
desktop\/modal\/help.interact.php.Pour les actions vous pouvez utiliser #c: For actions you can use #color# (required fiel if the command type is color) for the value of a color or #slider# (required fiel if the command type is slider) for the value of a slider.
desktop\/modal\/help.interact.php.Vous pouvez utiliser #valeur# et #unite: You can use #valeur# and #unite# for the return (they will be replaced by the value and the unit of the command). All value passed through request (#mavaleur #) are reachable. You have also #heure#, #date#, #jour# et #datetime#.
desktop\/modal\/help.interact.php.Vous pouvez utiliser le champ conversion: You can use the fiel « binary conversion » to convert binary values (0 and 1):
desktop\/modal\/help.interact.php.Le champ personne permet de n'autoriser: The person field allow to authorize just some people to run a command, but several profiles can be added by separate them with |.

desktop\/modal\/help.cronSyntaxe.php.Une fois par an à 5h10 le 18 Février: Once a year at 5.10 am the 18th February
desktop\/modal\/help.cronSyntaxe.php.Une fois par mois à 18:14 le second jour: Once a month at 6.14pm the 2nd day
desktop\/modal\/help.cronSyntaxe.php.Une fois par semaine le mardi à 12:00: Once a week on Tuesday at 12.00am
desktop\/modal\/help.cronSyntaxe.php.Le premier mardi du mois à 15h00: The first Tuesday of each month at 3.00pm
desktop\/modal\/help.cronSyntaxe.php.L'astérisque indique que l'expression cr: The asterisk means that the cron expression take all values from the field. E.g. : using it (*) in the 4th field (month) means each month.
desktop\/modal\/help.cronSyntaxe.php.Les virgules sont utilisées pour séparer: Comma are used to separate element in a list. E.g.: By using "MON,WED,FRI" in the 5th field (day of the week) means each Monday, Wednesday and Friday.
desktop\/modal\/help.cronSyntaxe.php.Tirets définissent les plages. Par exemp: Hyphens define a range. E.g.: 2000-2010 means that every year between 2000 and 2010 are included.
desktop\/modal\/help.cronSyntaxe.php.'L' signifie \"dernier\". Lorsqu'il est: 'L' means "last one". When it is used for week day, it allows to specify some construction like "the last friday" ("5L1") of a fixed month. For day of a month, it specifies the last day of a month.
desktop\/modal\/help.cronSyntaxe.php.«#» Est autorisé pour le champ du jour d: «#» is permitted for the field « day of the week », and must be followed by a number between 1 and 5. It allows you to specify some constructions like "the second friday" of a fixed month.
desktop\/modal\/help.cronSyntaxe.php.Remarque: Point d'interrogation est un c: Remark: Question mark is an atypical characters and only exist in some cron implementation. It is used instead of '*' to leave and let empty the day of the month or of the week.

desktop\/modal\/report.bug.php.Attention lors de l'envoi d'un rapport d: Be careful during the send of bug report, every log are automatically sent at the same time. However this log are accessible only by you and the support team.
